Ubuntu (feisty/gutsy/hardy/intrepid/jaunty) Zero Install is all recent versions of Ubuntu, so you can just do: $ sudo apt-get install zeroinstall-injector
Intrepid users can also install by clicking here.
Hardy (8.04): a later version is .
Jaunty (9.04): The version in Jaunty doesn't work with FTP downloads due to a bug, but contains a fix.
Knoppix 5 works using the Debian package; use apt-get update; apt-get install -f to fetch the dependencies
